narrative.narrative: Sky Express was a low cost airline around from operations start at January 29,2007 until its merger into Kuban Airlines on October 29,2011. Its base was Moscow Vnukovo. From VKO it went to Sochi,St. Petersburg,Eketerinburg,Kaliningrad,Rostov on Don,Krasnodar,Chelyabinsk,Murmansk,Perm and Tyumen. Charters were done seasonal in the summers of 2009 and 2010 to international destinations. This included two in Finland, three in Greece,one in Hungary,one in Montenegro,one in Spain,one in Macedonia,one in Sweden and one in Turkey. Its fleet at the time of the merger was eight 737-500's of which it had 7 at the start in 2007,three 737-300's which it had at the start also,and three A319's which it got in the months in 2011 prior to merging. Kuban got the A319's,two of the 737-300's and two of the 737-500's at the merger.
